{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = Archer-T4U_1).jpg |image1_size = 150px |caption = AC1200 Wireless Dual Band USB Adapter |caption2 = |pp = http://www.tp-link.com/us/products/details/cat-5520_Archer-T4U.html |sp = https://www.tp-link.com/en/support/download/Archer-T4U_V1/ |dl = |wikidevi = TP-LINK_Archer_T4U |wikipedia = |brand = TP-LINK |model = Archer T4 |submodelappend = |submodel = U |revision = v1 |subrevision = |model_part_num = |page_start_date = July 17, 2013 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/TP-LINK_Archer_T4U |sernum = |wlclass = AC1200 |series = Archer T |if = USB |if_bus_version = 3.0 |ifconnector = Male A |formfactor = dongle |vendor_id = 2357 |device_id = 0101 |subvendor_id = |subdevice_id = |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = TE7T4U |icid = 8853A-T4U |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = |chip1 = Realtek;RTL8812AU;RTL8812AU, CAH06P2, GC47; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = |antenna = |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac |802.11ac = 867 |802.11n = 300/300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = Yes |addchip = 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5022T;SiGe, 5022T, 503CH;2; |flags = DFS, |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = common |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 02/09/2014 |estreldate = |price = |upc = 845973050863 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B00JBJ6VG8 |asin_country = US |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |country = China |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== "2052500409" and the ''TP-LINK'' logo is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. The USB ID for this device is per the driver set for the [[Amped Wireless ACA1]]. :The device description matches up with ''TP-LINK'''s tag line for this device. {{seealso|TP-LINK Archer T series}} ==Links of Interest== *[https://makerforce.io/tp-link-archer-t4u-teardown/ ''TP-LINK Archer T4U Teardown'' on '''MakerForce'''] (internal images) :WIP Linux Driver: [https://github.com/ulli-kroll/rtl8821au rtl8821au] • [https://github.com/gnab/rtl8812au rtl8821au] • [https://github.com/diederikdehaas/rtl8812AU rtl8812au] • [https://github.com/Grawp/rtl8812au_rtl8821au rtl8812au_rtl8821au] ===Review of Linux Compatibility=== [http://m.linux-hardware-guide.com/2014-11-02-tp-link-archer-t4u-ac1200-usb-adapter-wifi-802-11bgnac-1200mbits-wpsusb-3-0 TP-Link Archer T4U] is a USB WiFi adapter for WiFi connections to 802.11ac standard. :The stick supports USB 3.0 and has the USB ID: 2357:0101 BUS 002 Device 023: ID 2357:0101 The stick bases on the Realtek RTL8812AU chipset, which currently :is not automatically recognized by the Linux kernel. ==Pictures==
'''Retail Images''' Image:Archer-T4U_1).jpg|angled, upright Image:Archer-T4U_2).jpg|angled, USB conn. side Image:Archer-T4U_3).jpg|angled, top Image:Archer-T4U_4).jpg|angled, front USB conn. side Image:Archer-T4U_5)00.jpg|packaging
[[Has images::retail| ]][[Has images::external| ]]
'''User Images''' File:TP-LINK Archer T4U back.jpg|back File:TP-LINK Archer T4U pcb.jpg|pcb
[[Has images::internal| ]] ==Notes== ====Edimax Driver==== *A driver for the Realtek chipset of the T4U is provided by Edimax. :However, the USB ID of the TP-Link Archer T4U is not known to this driver. :Therefore, a patched version of the Edimax driver exists, where the USB ID was added. ====Open Source Driver==== There is also an open source driver under development. This driver can be downloaded from GitHub: 
git clone https://github.com/abperiasamy/rtl8812AU_8821AU_linux.git
cd rtl8812AU_8821AU_linux/
As of Oct 16, 2016 this driver contains the USB ID of the Archer T4U. The driver can be compiled and installed with: 
make
sudo make install
If the TP-Link Archer T4U is plugged in, the kernel module rtl8812au should be loaded automatically: 
usb 1-1: new high-speed USB device number 2 using ehci-pci
usb 1-1: New USB device found, idVendor=2357, idProduct=0101
usb 1-1: New USB device strings: Mfr=1, Product=2, SerialNumber=3
usb 1-1: Product: 802.11n NIC
usb 1-1: Manufacturer: Realtek
usb 1-1: SerialNumber: 123456
cfg80211: Calling CRDA to update world regulatory domain
8812au: module verification failed: signature and/or  required key missing 
      - tainting kernel
cfg80211: World regulatory domain updated:
cfg80211:   (start_freq - end_freq @ bandwidth), (max_antenna_gain, max_eirp)
cfg80211:   (2402000 KHz - 2472000 KHz @ 40000 KHz), (300 mBi, 2000 mBm)
cfg80211:   (2457000 KHz - 2482000 KHz @ 40000 KHz), (300 mBi, 2000 mBm)
cfg80211:   (2474000 KHz - 2494000 KHz @ 20000 KHz), (300 mBi, 2000 mBm)
cfg80211:   (5170000 KHz - 5250000 KHz @ 40000 KHz), (300 mBi, 2000 mBm)
cfg80211:   (5735000 KHz - 5835000 KHz @ 40000 KHz), (300 mBi, 2000 mBm)
usbcore: registered new interface driver rtl8812au
